explanation:
MISRA C:2023 R8.13 requires pointers to be to const-qualified types whenever possible. In metal_uio_dev_bind the parameter ldrv is only read: the code accesses ldrv->drv_name and ldrv->sdrv (and then uses those values), it does not modify the linux_driver object or any of its members. The struct linux_driver already declares drv_name and mod_name as const char * so those members are read-only by design. Declaring the parameter as const struct linux_driver *ldrv would be valid here (accessing ldrv->sdrv from a const struct linux_driver yields a const pointer-to-pointer-object but the pointed-to sysfs_driver remains non-const and can be passed to functions that may modify it). Therefore the function as shown does not follow the guidance of R8.13 and the agent A report is correct.

Note: if there were an external requirement (for example a callback type) forcing this function to match a non-const prototype, that would be a legitimate reason to keep the non-const parameter. As the function is static and no such constraint is visible in the snippet, making ldrv const is appropriate.
